Recent Cases

Lung
Lung Cancer

Title - 58 year old relapsed metastatic squamous cell NSCLC patient
Tumor Type - Lung
Stage - IV
Age - 58
Metastatic - NO
Mutations - Tissue Biopsy & Liquid Biopsy PD-L1 & Met
ECOG - PS 2
Prior Lines of Therapy - 2, Platinum Doublet (6 months) / Pembrolizumab (10 months)
Other Relevant Info - Slightly imparied renal function. Re-biopsy with LBx showed a C-Met Mutation.
Question - Would a Met inhibitor benefit this patient?

Dr. Kelly Rowan
March 12, 2022 ·
Pancreatic
Pancreatic

Title - 73 year old relapsed metastatic pancreatic cancer patient
Tumor Type - Pancreatic
Stage - IV
Age - 73
Metastatic - Liver
Mutations - Tissue Biopsy - KRas
ECOG - PS 2
Prior Lines of Therapy - 1, FOLFIRINOX (14 months)
Other Relevant Info - Elevated bilirubin
Question - Would Gem+Abraxane benefit this patient and would a 3/4 or every 2 week schedule be better?

Dr. Josiah Barclay
March 23, 2022 ·
Bladder
Bladder

Title - 67 year old relapsed metastatic bladder cancer patient
Tumor Type - Bladder Cancer
Stage - IV
Age - 67
Metastatic - Lung & Liver
Mutations - Tissue Biopsy & Liquid Biopsy PD-L1 & Met
ECOG - PS 2
Prior Lines of Therapy - 1, Gemcitabine + Cisplatin (12 months)
Other Relevant Info - Increased ALT and AST
Question - What is the best option to treat this patient in the second line?

Dr. Evelyn Martinez
